statement.tex: \text{Find the distance of point }\left(-1,-5, -10\right)\text{ from} \\ \text{the point where the line } \ora{r}=\vector{2}{-}{2}+ \\ \lambda(\vector{3}{4}{2}) \text{ passes through the plane} \\ \ora{r}\cdot(\vector{1}{-}{1})=5.

step.context: \textbf{Intersection of line and plane} \\ \text{If a point lies on plane }\ora{r}\cdot(\vector{1}{-}{1})=5 \\ \text{as well as on line }\ora{r}=\vector{2}{-}{2}+ \\ \lambda(\vector{3}{4}{2})\text{, is the following a valid} \\ \text{expression for it?}
step.reason: \text{For the given line, the position vector of any} \\ \text{point on this line can be expressed as} \\ \ora{r}=\vector{(2+3\lambda)}{(-1+4\lambda)}{(2+2\lambda)} \\ \text{Similarly for the given plane, the position} \\ \text{vector of any point on it is can be expressed as} \\ \ora{r}\cdot(\vector{1}{-}{1})=5. \\ \text{When the point lies on {\bf both the line and the}} \\ \textbf{plane}\text{, they are said to{\bf intersect}.To establish} \\ \text{the point of interection, the two expressions for} \\ \text{position vector of the point can be equated.} \\ {\bf\small{\left(\vector{(2+3\lambda)}{(-1+4\lambda)}{(2+2\lambda)} \right)\cdot}} \\ \qquad{\bf\small{(\vector{1}{-}{1})=5}}

step.context: \text{What is the distance between intersection point} \\ (2,-1,2)\text{ and given point }(-1, -5, -10)?
